classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as ubiquinones. These are coenzyme Q derivatives containing a 5, 6-dimethoxy-3-methyl(1,4-benzoquinone) moiety to which an isoprenyl group is attached at ring position 2(or 6).

category.category: Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Succinate dehydrogenase flavoprotein subunit
polypeptide.specific-function: Two distinct, membrane-bound, FAD-containing enzymes are responsible for the catalysis of fumarate and succinate interconversion; the fumarate reductase is used in anaerobic growth, and the succinate dehydrogenase is used in aerobic growth.

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Succinate dehydrogenase iron-sulfur subunit
polypeptide.specific-function: Two distinct, membrane-bound, FAD-containing enzymes are responsible for the catalysis of fumarate and succinate interconversion; the fumarate reductase is used in anaerobic growth, and the succinate dehydrogenase is used in aerobic growth.

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Succinate dehydrogenase cytochrome b556 subunit
polypeptide.specific-function: Membrane-anchoring subunit of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH).

target.name: Succinate dehydrogenase hydrophobic membrane anchor subunit

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Succinate dehydrogenase hydrophobic membrane anchor subunit
polypeptide.specific-function: Membrane-anchoring subunit of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH).

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c1, heme protein, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: This is the heme-containing component of the cytochrome b-c1 complex, which accepts electrons from Rieske protein and transfers electrons to cytochrome c in the mitochondrial respiratory chain.

synonyms.synonym: Ubiquinol-cytochrome-c reductase complex cytochrome c1 subunit

go-classifier.description: electron transporter, transferring electrons from CoQH2-cytochrome c reductase complex and cytochrome c oxidase complex activity

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b
polypeptide.specific-function: Component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is a respiratory chain that generates an electrochemical potential coupled to ATP synthesis.

synonyms.synonym: Ubiquinol-cytochrome-c reductase complex cytochrome b subunit

go-classifier.description: mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit 1, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: This is a component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is part of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. This protein may mediate formation of the complex between cytochromes c and c1.

go-classifier.description: mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit 2, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: This is a component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is part of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The core protein 2 is required for the assembly of the complex.

go-classifier.description: mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit 6, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: This is a component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is part of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. This protein may mediate formation of the complex between cytochromes c and c1.

synonyms.synonym: Ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex 11 kDa protein

go-classifier.description: mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit 8
polypeptide.specific-function: This is a component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is part of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. This subunit, together with cytochrome b, binds to ubiquinone.

synonyms.synonym: Ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex 9.5 kDa protein
Ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex ubiquinone-binding protein QP-C

target.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit Rieske, mitochondrial

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit Rieske, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: Component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is a respiratory chain that generates an electrochemical potential coupled to ATP synthesis.The transit peptide of the Rieske protein seems to form part of the bc1 complex and is considered to be the subunit 11/IX of that complex.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit 10
polypeptide.specific-function: This is a component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is part of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.This protein may be closely linked to the iron-sulfur protein in the complex and function as an iron-sulfur protein binding factor.

synonyms.synonym: Ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex 6.4 kDa protein

go-classifier.description: generation of precursor metabolites and energy

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit 7
polypeptide.specific-function: This is a component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is part of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. This component is involved in redox-linked proton pumping.

synonyms.synonym: Ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex 14 kDa protein

go-classifier.description: mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome b-c1 complex subunit 9
polypeptide.specific-function: This is a component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is part of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. This subunit interacts with cytochrome c1 (By similarity).

synonyms.synonym: Ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex 7.2 kDa protein

go-classifier.description: mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c

target.name: Photosynthetic reaction center cytochrome c subunit

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Photosynthetic reaction center cytochrome c subunit
polypeptide.specific-function: The reaction center of purple bacteria contains a tightly bound cytochrome molecule which re-reduces the photo oxidized primary electron donor.

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Reaction center protein H chain
polypeptide.general-function: Electron transporter, transferring electrons within the cyclic electron transport pathway of photosynthesis activity
polypeptide.specific-function: The reaction center is a membrane-bound complex that mediates the initial photochemical event in the electron transfer process of photosynthesis.

go-classifier.description: electron transporter, transferring electrons within the cyclic electron transport pathway of photosynthesis activity

article.citation: Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Disulfide bond formation protein B
polypeptide.specific-function: Required for disulfide bond formation in some periplasmic proteins such as PhoA or OmpA. Acts by oxidizing the DsbA protein. PhoP-regulated transcription is redox-sensitive, being activated when the periplasm becomes more reducing (deletion of dsbA/dsbB, treatment with dithiothreitol). MgrB acts between DsbA/DsbB and PhoP/PhoQ in this pathway.

polypeptide.specific-function: Component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex (complex III or cytochrome b-c1 complex), which is a respiratory chain that generates an electrochemical potential coupled to ATP synthesis. c1 functions as an electron donor to cytochrome c.
